Class DogView

java.lang.Object
view.entityViews.DogView
public class DogView extends Object
view counterpart of the Dog model. handles the rendering logic of a single dog instance. all the dog sprites are loaded once in the EnemyView constructor.

    • notchasing

      private static BufferedImage notchasing
      indicators of the dog sprites, if chasing or not.

    • spriteCounter

      private int spriteCounter
      sprite counter. this helps to display the dog animations. it essentially is a counter tightly coupled with the game frame rate. for example, if the frame rate it 60fps, then this counter will increment by 60 times per second. each time this number reaches a certain threshold, the spriteNum increments.

    • spriteNum

      private int spriteNum
      sprite number. each dog sprite is related to this number. it increments once the spriteCounter reaches a certain threshold. for example, if the sprite number is '1' when the dog is idle, it will display the first idle dog sprite.

    • wasDisabled

      private boolean wasDisabled
      helper boolean field that indicates if the dog was disabled or not. it helps to display the disabled animation from sprite number 1.

  • Constructor Details

    • DogView

      public DogView(Dog dog)
      creates a dog view instance, that handles the rendering / visual side of the model.
      Parameters:
      dog - reference to the Dog model that his view is rendering

  • Method Details

    • loadSprites

      public static void loadSprites()
      loads all the dog sprites from the 'res' folder. called to load all the sprites in the EnemyView constructor, so it loads all the sprites once.

    • updateFrameCounter

      private void updateFrameCounter()
      updates the spriteCounter depending on the dog's current state. by updating the sprite counter and its sprite number, it creates an animation effect. called in the draw(Graphics2D) method.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2d)
      draws the dog based on its current state and position given by the Dog model. the sprite counter speed is handled in updateFrameCounter(), and the sprite cycling (to create the animation) is handled by the switchDisabledSprites(String), switchIdleSprite(String) and switchMovingSprite(String).
      Parameters:
      g2d - swing's graphics 2d instance that allows rendering

    • switchIdleSprite

      private BufferedImage switchIdleSprite(String direction)
      switches the image based on the spriteNum field. contains the dog's idle state sprites.
      Parameters:
      direction - direction of the dog
      Returns:
      an image, current sprite of the dog.

    • switchMovingSprite

      private BufferedImage switchMovingSprite(String direction)
      switches the image based on the spriteNum field. contains the dog's moving state sprites.
      Parameters:
      direction - direction of the dog
      Returns:
      an image, current sprite of the dog.

    • switchDisabledSprites

      private BufferedImage switchDisabledSprites(String direction)
      switches the image based on the spriteNum field. contains the dog's disabled state sprites.
      Parameters:
      direction - direction of the dog
      Returns:
      an image, current sprite of the dog.
